p: In recent years, recurrent measles outbreaks, primarily affecting children below 5 years of age [ 1], have been reported in several areas of Ethiopia [ 1, 14], including the Oromia Region [ 4]. In Ethiopia, the national Expanded Programme on Immunization was established in 1980 and consists of the first dose of measles-containing vaccine (MCV1) administered at 9 months of age. Routine immunization of infants is supplemented by planned campaigns at 2- and 5-year intervals [ 3], aimed at increasing vaccination coverage and providing the opportunity for a second dose of vaccine to children who did not respond to the first one [ 3].
